definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: Shakespeare's remains were guarded by a malediction .
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亞的遺骸被詛咒給守護著。

sentences.english: I am the waylaid pieces of history which sank out of sight in all of our pasts.
sentences.chinese: 我是所有我們過去中，沉沒在視線外的歷史遺骸。

sentences.english: HAS now been restored in the Palaeontological Museum in Leningrad.
sentences.chinese: 這一猛獁遺骸現已修復陳列在列寧格勒古生物博物館。

sentences.english: Lead coffins tend to keep human remains well-preserved.
sentences.chinese: 鉛質棺材一般傾向於保存完好的遺骸。

sentences.english: “He asked Lincoln for help in recovering his wife’s body,” said Milligan.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特請林肯幫忙搜尋他亡妻的遺骸。

sentences.english: Carcasses populate the brush, their putrid remains swallowed whole by the land.
sentences.chinese: 屍體居住於刷子，他們的腐敗遺骸由土地吞下了整體。

sentences.english: After maintenance the main remains and remainders remain onthe domain.
sentences.chinese: 維修之後重要遺骸和盈餘物留在了領地上。

sentences.english: Diatomaceous earths are the skeletal remains of the tiny aquatic plants deposited centuries ago.
sentences.chinese: 硅藻土是百年前水生植物沉澱下來的遺骸。

sentences.english: After maintenance the main remains and remainders are left on the domain.
sentences.chinese: 維修之後，重要遺骸和殘餘物留在拉領地上。

sentences.english: The vultures feasted on a rabbit carcass.
sentences.chinese: 禿鷹盡情享用著一隻兔子的遺骸。

sentences.english: Lycidas was drowned. His remains are unrecoverable.
sentences.chinese: 利西達斯溺死於大海，他的遺骸已經找不到了。

sentences.english: Coal is formed from the remains of fresh-water plants.
sentences.chinese: 煤是由淡水植物遺骸形成的。

sentences.english: When you call me 'senior, ' I feel like a prehistoric relic. Why do you add the word 'elder'?
sentences.chinese: 你叫我‘前輩’，我已經覺得像史前原人的遺骸了。

sentences.english: Soon our yard was filled with the remains of these other women.
sentences.chinese: 很快我們的院子裏滿是這些其他女人的遺骸。

sentences.english: The remains were found in a cave in the Asturias region of Northern Spain.
sentences.chinese: 這些遺骸是在西班牙北部阿斯圖利亞地區被發現的。

definition: fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
to vanish gradually/to disappear/to fade out
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
to see the light again (idiom); delivered from oppression
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
to sacrifice oneself in a just cause/a victim of a disaster
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
an execution/to put sb to death
